<A NAME="eolPage105"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<!-- FIELD: /PAGE -->
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
	SodaStream International Ltd.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0">
<B>
	Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0">
</P>
<!-- FIELD: RULE-PAGE -->
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0; MARGIN-TOP: 0; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 1PT; BORDER-TOP: BLACK 1PT SOLID; WIDTH: 100%">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
</DIV>
<!-- FIELD: /RULE-PAGE -->
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Note 5 - Financial risk management
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Overview
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Group has exposure to the following
	risks from its use of financial instruments:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.5IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	credit risk
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.5IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	liquidity risk
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.5IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	market risk (including currency, interest and other market
	price risks)
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	This note presents information about
	the Group&rsquo;s exposure to each of the above risks, the Group&rsquo;s objectives, policies and processes for measuring and managing
	risk, and the Group&rsquo;s management of capital. Further quantitative disclosures are included throughout these consolidated
	financial&nbsp;statements.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
	The Group&rsquo;s
	risk management policies are established to identify and analyze the risks faced by the Group, to set appropriate risk limits and
	controls, and to monitor risks and adherence to limits. Risk management policies and systems are reviewed regularly to reflect
	changes in market conditions and the Group&rsquo;s activities. The Group, through its training and management standards, aims to
	develop a disciplined and constructive control environment in which all employees understand their roles and obligations.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Risk management framework
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Board of Directors has overall
	responsibility for the establishment and oversight of the Group&rsquo;s risk management framework.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Company established an economic
	department in charge of risk management in three primary levels: currency, interest and commodity.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Group&rsquo;s strategy is to
	minimize its exposure to currency risk by using derivative instruments such as plain vanilla options, and other various instruments.
	The Group's tendency is not to enter into derivative transactions that can increase its exposure and not to protect immaterial
	activity amounts. The Group does not enter into derivative transactions for trading or speculative purposes.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Credit risk
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Credit risk is the risk of financial
	loss to the Group if a customer or counterparty to a financial instrument fails to meet its contractual obligations, and arises
	principally from the Group&rsquo;s receivables from customers.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Group&rsquo;s exposure to credit
	risk is influenced mainly by the individual characteristics of each customer. The demographics of the Group&rsquo;s customer base,
	including the default risk of the industry and country, in which customers operate, has less of an influence on credit risk.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Group&rsquo;s exposure to credit
	risk relating to trade receivables is further disclosed in Note 24(A).
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Group has established a credit
	policy under which each new customer is analyzed individually for creditworthiness before the Group&rsquo;s standard payment and
	delivery terms and conditions are offered. The Group&rsquo;s review includes external ratings, when available, and in some cases
	bank references. Purchase limits are established for each customer, which represents the maximum open amount without requiring
	specific approval from the management.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 105; VALUE: 2 -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID">
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 33%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 34%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	F-
<!-- FIELD: SEQUENCE; TYPE: ARABIC; NAME: PAGENO -->
	28
<!-- FIELD: /SEQUENCE -->
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 33%; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage106"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<!-- FIELD: /PAGE -->
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
	SodaStream International Ltd.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0">
<B>
	Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0">
</P>
<!-- FIELD: RULE-PAGE -->
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0; MARGIN-TOP: 0; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 1PT; BORDER-TOP: BLACK 1PT SOLID; WIDTH: 100%">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
</DIV>
<!-- FIELD: /RULE-PAGE -->
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Note 5 - Financial risk management &ndash;
	(continued)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	These limits are reviewed periodically.
	The majority of the balances are secured by letters of credit, bank guarantees or insurance. Customers that fail to meet the Group&rsquo;s
	benchmark creditworthiness may transact with the Group only on a prepayment basis.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Group establishes an allowance
	for impairment that represents its estimate of incurred losses in respect of trade receivables. The main component of this allowance
	is a specific loss component that relates to individual exposures. All individually significant receivables found not to be impaired
	are collectively assessed for any impairment that has been incurred but not identified.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Liquidity risk
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Liquidity risk is the risk of inability
	or difficulty in connection with meeting the obligations associated with the Group's financial liabilities that are settled by
	delivering cash or another financial asset. The Group&rsquo;s approach to managing liquidity is to ensure, as far as possible,
	that it will always have sufficient liquidity to meet its liabilities when due, under both normal and stressed conditions, without
	incurring unacceptable losses or risking damage to the Group&rsquo;s reputation.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Group ensures that it has sufficient
	cash on demand to meet expected operational expenses for a period of approximately 60 days, including the servicing of financial
	obligations; this excludes the potential impact of extreme circumstances that cannot reasonably be predicted, such as natural disasters.
	In addition, the Group maintains a secured line of credit in the amount of $11.3 million with certain Israeli banks. To the extent
	such line of credit is utilized, interest is payable at a rate of LIBOR (or Prime, with respect to credit lines denominated in
	NIS) plus between 75 and 200 basis points.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Group's exposure to liquidity
	risk is further disclosed in note 24(B).
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Market risk
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Market risk is the risk of changes
	in market prices, such as foreign exchange rates and interest rates will affect the Group&rsquo;s income or the value of its holdings
	of financial instruments. The objective of market risk management is to manage and control market risk exposures within acceptable
	parameters, while optimizing the return.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Group buys and sells derivative
	financial instruments in order to manage market risks. Generally, the Group seeks to moderate its exposure to market risks and
	manage volatility in the statement of operations.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<I>
	Currency risk
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Group is exposed to currency
	risk on sales and purchases that are denominated in a currency other than the respective functional currencies of Group entities,
	primarily the USD and the Euro, but also the Australian Dollar (AUD), Swedish Krona (SEK), Swiss Francs (CHF), Sterling (GBP),
	New Israeli Shekel (NIS), Canadian Dollar (CAD), South African Rand (ZAR), Danish Krona (DKK), Norwegian Krona (NOK), Japanese
	Yen (JPY) and New Zealand Dollar (NZD).
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Group is primarily exposed to
	fluctuations of the Euro and the NIS against the U.S. Dollar. Revenue is primarily denominated in the U.S. Dollar and the Euro.
	Significant material purchasing, production costs and operational expenses are denominated in the U.S. Dollar, Euro and NIS. Most
	of the principal amounts of the Group&rsquo;s bank loans are denominated in Euro, which provide an economic hedge without derivatives
	being entered into and without application of hedge accounting. Interest on borrowings is denominated in the currency of the borrowing.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 106; VALUE: 2 -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID">
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 33%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 34%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	F-
<!-- FIELD: SEQUENCE; TYPE: ARABIC; NAME: PAGENO -->
	29
<!-- FIELD: /SEQUENCE -->
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 33%; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>

</TABLE>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage107"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<!-- FIELD: /PAGE -->
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
	SodaStream International Ltd.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0">
<B>
	Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0">
</P>
<!-- FIELD: RULE-PAGE -->
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0; MARGIN-TOP: 0; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 1PT; BORDER-TOP: BLACK 1PT SOLID; WIDTH: 100%">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
</DIV>
<!-- FIELD: /RULE-PAGE -->
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Note 5 - Financial risk management &ndash;
	(continued)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Group uses derivative instruments
	in order to reduce the exposure to currency risks.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Group&rsquo;s investments in
	subsidiaries are not covered by these derivative contracts, as these positions are considered to be long-term in nature.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<I>
	Interest rate risk
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Group&rsquo;s bank deposits and
	bank overdrafts are subject to fluctuating interest rates, which depend on the loan period and the currency involved. Management
	closely monitors the Group&rsquo;s interest rate exposures on an on-going basis.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Group's exposure to market risks
	is further disclosed in Note 24(C).
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Capital management
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Board of Directors&rsquo; policy
	is to maintain a strong capital base so as to maintain investor and creditor confidence and to sustain future development of the
	business.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 107; VALUE: 2 -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID">
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">

	&nbsp;

<A NAME="eolPage108"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<!-- FIELD: /PAGE -->
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
	SodaStream International Ltd.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0">
<B>
	Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0">
</P>
<!-- FIELD: RULE-PAGE -->
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0; MARGIN-TOP: 0; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 1PT; BORDER-TOP: BLACK 1PT SOLID; WIDTH: 100%">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
</DIV>
<!-- FIELD: /RULE-PAGE -->
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Note 6 - Operating segments
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Group&rsquo;s segment performance
	is assessed periodically by the Group&rsquo;s management and reported to the Board of Directors, which acts as the Group&rsquo;s
	CODM. These segments are represented by geographical regions. Each region has similar characteristics relevant to the Group business
	and usually includes several markets in which it sells its products. The sales of the Group's products in the markets are managed
	either by wholly owned subsidiaries or by external third-party distributors. The reported performance of these markets is provided
	periodically and is consolidated in the Group's headquarters for the purpose of presentation to the CODM.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<U>
	Segment information
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Segment information is based on the
	geographical location of customers as reported to the CODM. CODM business decisions are primarily based on the market data of the
	various markets in which the Group operates. The data received by the CODM consists of revenues from external customers and segment
	results by market, which include items directly attributable to each market as well as those that can be allocated on a reasonable
	basis. The operating segments&rsquo; accounting policies are identical to the accounting policies applied in these financial statements.
	Inter-company transactions are not reported in the management reports and thus not presented in the segment information. Asset
	and liability data is not reported in the operating segment information since it is not reviewed by the CODM.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Company aggregates the different
	markets in which the Group operates into four main reportable geographical segments as set forth below:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.5IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
	-
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Americas
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.5IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
	-
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Western Europe
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.5IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
	-
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Asia-Pacific
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.5IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
	-
</TD>
<TD>
	Central and Eastern Europe, Middle East and Africa
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Group's management aggregates
	the different markets based on consumer characteristics and geographical proximity.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Segment results are calculated in
	accordance with the management reports reported to the CODM and as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.5IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.5IN">
	1.
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	For markets in which marketing is performed by third-party distributors, segment results represent
	revenues from external customers, less direct cost of revenues and less advertising expenses for that market.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.5IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.5IN">
	2.
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	For markets in which marketing is performed by the Group&rsquo;s wholly owned subsidiaries, segment
	results represent revenues from external customers, less direct cost of revenues and less other operating expenses (general and
	administrative and sales and marketing expenses).
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 1IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: -0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<U>
	Reconciliation to consolidated
	financial statements
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The reconciliation amounts include
	all other operating and financial expenses that were not related directly to the Group&rsquo;s sales and distribution activities
	and were not included in the expenses allocated to specific segments in the reports to the CODM.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>

	Note 6 - Operating segments &ndash; (continued)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	&nbsp;

<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
	(1)
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Revenues from one customer of the Group&rsquo;s Western Europe segment represents approximately $37.3 million (2014 and 2013:
	$62.0 million and $71.9 million, respectively) of the Group&rsquo;s total revenues.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0">

<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
	(2)
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Reconciling items include restructuring costs of $9.5 million comprised of charges to revenue of $2.8 million, impairment of
	inventory of $3.2 million, impairment of property, plant and equipment of $1.0 million, employee benefits of $1.9 million and operating
	expenses of $0.6 million. Other reconciling items are recurring items that are not related directly to the Group&rsquo;s sales
	and distribution activities and were not allocated to the different segments by the Company's Chief Operating Decision Maker. Such
	items include primarily unallocated operating overhead costs and share based payments.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

	&nbsp;

<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
	(1)
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Reconciling items include restructuring costs and goodwill impairment in the amount of $15.6 million and $3.3 million, respectively.
	Other reconciling items are recurring items that are not related directly to the Group&rsquo;s sales and distribution activities
	and were not allocated to the different segments by the Company's Chief Operating Decision Maker. Such items include primarily
	unallocated operating overhead costs and share based payments.
</TD>

<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">

<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Reconciling items are recurring items that are not related directly to the Group&rsquo;s sales and distribution activities
	and were not allocated to the different segments by the Company's Chief Operating Decision Maker. Such items include primarily
	unallocated operating overhead costs and share based payments.

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Information on geographical segments
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Information regarding the assets
	of each geographical segment is detailed below. The information includes non-current assets data, of which the depreciated cost
	of property, plant and equipment is allocated to each of the geographical segments, and the intangible assets&rsquo; amortized
	cost, deferred tax asset and other receivables are not allocated to the geographical segments.
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0">
<B>
	Note 7 &ndash; Acquisition of distribution business and operations
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.5IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	1.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Purchase of the Japanese distribution assets
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 70.9PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	In April 2014, the Group acquired
	its Japanese distribution assets, which included part of the distributer's inventory and fixed assets. The acquisition was accounted
	for as an asset acquisition.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 70.9PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 70.9PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The total consideration amounted
	to $7.3 million and was allocated as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 70.9PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>

	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.5IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	2.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Purchase of the Italian distribution business
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 70.9PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	In June 2013, the Group acquired
	its Italian distribution business and all related assets from its exclusive distributor, Eurometalnova S.P.A. (hereinafter &ndash;
	EMN). The acquisition was accounted for as a business combination. The total consideration amounted to $13.3 million, out of which
	$11.2 million was allocated to net identifiable assets, and the residual consideration of $2.1 million was recognized as goodwill.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 70.9PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Depreciation of machinery equipment
	(cost and grants), cylinders and vehicles is charged to cost of revenues. Depreciation of other categories of property, plant and
	equipment is charged to departments that utilize the relevant assets, primarily in cost of revenues and general and administrative
	expenses.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0">
<B>
	Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements
</B>
</P>
<!-- FIELD: RULE-PAGE -->
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0; MARGIN-TOP: 0; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0">

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0">

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0">
<B>
	Note 8 - Property, plant and equipment &ndash; (continued)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.5IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<B>
	A.
</B>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Restructuring
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	In 2015 the Group recognized an impairment
	loss of property, plant and equipment in the amount of $1.0 million in connection with its restructuring plan. The impairment loss
	is presented in cost of sales.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.5IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<B>
	B.
</B>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Capitalized borrowing costs
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	In the reporting period, specific
	borrowing costs in the amount of $584 thousand (2014: $503 thousands) were capitalized to qualifying assets related to the Group's
	construction of new plant in Southern Israel.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.5IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<B>
	C.
</B>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
	Property,
	plant and equipment
</B>
</FONT>
<B>
	under finance leases
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Group leases certain property,
	plant and equipment under a number of finance lease agreements. As of December 31, 2015, the net carrying amount of the leased
	land and buildings is $3.1 million (2014: $3.2 million).
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0">

	D.
</B>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
	Property,
	plant and equipment
</B>
</FONT>
<B>
	fully depreciated and still in use
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Group has assets that have been
	fully depreciated and are still in use. As of December 31, 2015, the original cost of such assets is $47 million (2014: $46 million).
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;

	Amortization of intangible assets is charged
	to the departments which utilize the relevant assets (i.e., cost of revenues, sales and marketing expenses or general and administrative
	expenses).

<!-- FIELD: /PAGE -->
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
	SodaStream International Ltd.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0">
<B>
	Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements
</B>
</P>
<!-- FIELD: RULE-PAGE -->
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0; MARGIN-TOP: 0; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 1PT; BORDER-TOP: BLACK 1PT SOLID; WIDTH: 100%">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
</DIV>
<!-- FIELD: /RULE-PAGE -->
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0">
<B>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0">
<B>
	Note 9 - Intangible assets &ndash; (continued)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.5IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<B>
	A.
</B>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Intangible assets with indefinite useful life
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Other than goodwill, the Group has
	intangible assets with indefinite useful life. Indefinite-lived intangible assets are comprised of trademarks in the amount of
	$15 million (2014: $15 million) for which there is no foreseeable limit to the period over which they are expected to generate
	net cash inflows. These are considered to have an indefinite life given the strength and durability of the group's brands and the
	level of marketing support.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.5IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<B>
	B.
</B>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Impairment of Goodwill
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	For the purpose of impairment testing,
	goodwill is allocated to the Group&rsquo;s operating divisions which represent the lowest level within the Group at which goodwill
	is monitored for internal management purposes, which is not higher than the operating segments, before the aggregation of segments,
	reported in Note 6 regarding operating segments.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	During 2014, the Company recorded
	goodwill impairment in the amount of $3.3 million. The impairment was in regard to the group's subsidiary, SodaStream Professional
	S.r.l (formally CEM), which was acquired in 2011. The recoverable amount of the subsidiary was based on its value in use and was
	determined by discounting the future cash flows projected to be generated from the continuing use of the unit. The value in use
	in 2014 was determined in a similar manner as in 2013. The impairment loss was allocated fully to goodwill and is included in other
	expenses.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.5IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<B>
	C.
</B>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Impairment of other intangible assets
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	During 2015 the Company recorded
	and impairment of $0.6 million in regard to a trademark originated from an acquisition of a subsidiary.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.5IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	(1)
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Out of total 41,614 RSU granted to a former shareholder of an acquired subsidiary, 6,936 RSU
	were vested in each of 2013, 2014, and 2015, respectively. The RSU relate to a deferred consideration with respect to the
	shares of the acquired subsidiary, which was
	accounted for as a compound instrument. As a result, in 2013 an amount of $156,000 has
	been classified to equity from other current liabilities.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<U>
	Shareholders&rsquo; rights
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Holders of ordinary shares are entitled
	to participate equally in the payment of cash dividends and in stock dividend distributions. Each ordinary share is entitled to
	one vote on all matters to be voted on by shareholders.

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Refer to note 24B for the loans contractual
	payment schedule.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Pledges and guarantees
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	For the purpose of constructing its new factory
	in Southern Israel, the Group has taken long term bank loans with respect to which the Group recorded first degree pledges on its
	land and land development rights in Southern Israel in favor of the lending banks. In addition, in order to secure fulfillment
	of the conditions related to the receipt of government grants, a floating lien was registered in favor of the State of Israel on
	substantially all of the assets of the Company's manufacturing subsidiary.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Group has agreed not to pledge
	or charge and not to undertake to pledge or charge its assets (&ldquo;negative pledge&rdquo;), following agreements with financial
	institutions regarding the receipt of certain bank services, including loans and credit facilities.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
	SodaStream International Ltd.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0">
<B>
	Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements
</B>
</P>
<!-- FIELD: RULE-PAGE -->
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0; MARGIN-TOP: 0; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 1PT; BORDER-TOP: BLACK 1PT SOLID; WIDTH: 100%">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
</DIV>
<!-- FIELD: /RULE-PAGE -->
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0">
<B>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0">
<B>
	Note 15 - Employee benefits
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
	Employee benefits
	include post-employment benefits, other long-term benefits, short-term benefits and share-based payments.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Group&rsquo;s liability for employee
	severance benefits in respect of its Israeli employees is in accordance with the Israeli Severance Pay Law &ndash; 1963 (hereinafter
	&ndash; the Severance Law). For employment periods from July 2010 onwards, with respect to most of its Israeli employees, the Company
	has a defined contribution plan for which under Section 14 of the Severance Law, contributions to the plan are in lieu of payments
	of severance pay. For employment periods before July 2010, with respect to its Israeli employees, and for employment periods after
	July 2010 regarding some of its Israeli employees, the Group has defined benefit plans for which it makes contributions to central
	severance pay funds and appropriate insurance policies. The Company has an additional reserve deposited in the Company's name in
	a recognized compensation fund.
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
</FONT>
	Withdrawal of the reserve accruals
	is contingent upon fulfillment of detailed provisions in the Severance Law.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
	Some of the non-Israeli
	subsidiaries calculate an actuarial obligation regarding post-employment benefits according to the local defined benefit plans
	employees are entitled to.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
	Other long-term
	benefits consist of seniority grant obligations.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Short-term benefits consist of salary
	and related expenses and liability for holiday pay.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
	For information
	regarding share-based payments, see Note 27.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The calculation of the defined benefit
	obligation is sensitive to the assumptions set out above. The following table summarizes the impact of changes in the respective
	assumptions on the defined benefit obligation at the end of the reporting period.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Defined benefit obligation
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_45"></A>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE; WIDTH: 80%; FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 0.5IN">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; PADDING-BOTTOM: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD COLSPAN="6" STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID">
	December 31, 2015
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-BOTTOM: 1PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	&nbsp;
</TD>

<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM">
<TD NOWRAP>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD NOWRAP STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; PADDING-BOTTOM: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD COLSPAN="2" NOWRAP STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID">
	0.5% increase
</TD>
<TD NOWRAP STYLE="PADDING-BOTTOM: 1PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD NOWRAP STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; PADDING-BOTTOM: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD COLSPAN="2" NOWRAP STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID">
	0.5% decrease
</TD>

	The above sensitivities are based
	on the average duration of the benefit obligation determined at the reporting date and are applied to adjust the defined benefit
	obligation for the assumption concerned.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;

	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Group contribution to its funded
	defined benefit plan is expected to be $224,000 in 2016.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;

</B>

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Group has a defined contribution
	plan in respect of the Company&rsquo;s liability to pay the saving component of provident funds and in respect of certain of its
	employees who are subject to Section 14 of the Israeli Severance Pay Law &ndash; 1963.
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
<U>
	Legal claims
</U>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	See Note 25
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
<U>
	Right of return
</U>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Group sells certain specific
	products with an unlimited right of return that entitle customers to a refund. In the opinion of the management of the Company,
	appropriate provisions have been included in the financial statement to cover the estimated refund obligations. The estimation
	was based on previous experience and relevant management assumptions.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN">
<B>
<U>
	Machinery and plant dismantling
</U>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN">
	A provision was made based on the Group&rsquo;s estimation
	of dismantling costs related to one of the Israeli production plants.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN">
<B>
<U>
	Warranties
</U>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN">
	The Group provides a limited warranty (lifetime or time
	limited) for products sold to customers.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
	SodaStream International Ltd.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 0.5PT SOLID">
<B>
	Notes to the Consolidated Financial
	Statements
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0">
<B>
	Note 22 - Income tax
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.5IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<B>
	A.
</B>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Details regarding the tax environment of the Group
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.5IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	1.
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<U>
	General
</U>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 1IN">
	The Group subsidiaries are incorporated in various countries
	where income is generally taxed at statutory rates. Certain subsidiaries benefit from tax incentives or subject to specific tax
	rulings.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 1IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 1IN">
	The regular corporate tax rate in Israel in 2015 is 26.5%
	(2014: 26.5%; 2013: 25%). Tax incentives to the Israeli subsidiaries are described below. Non-Israeli subsidiaries are taxed according
	to the tax laws in their respective country of residence.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 1IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 1IN">
	On August 5, 2013 the Israeli parliament (the Knesset) passed
	the Law for Changes in National Priorities (Legislative Amendments for Achieving Budget Objectives in the Years 2013 and 2014)
	&ndash; 2013, by which, inter alia, the corporate tax rate would be raised by 1.5% to a rate of 26.5% as from 2014. On January
	4, 2016, the Knesset plenum approved a bill to amend the Income Tax Ordinance, including a reduction in corporate tax by 1.5% from
	26.5% to 25%, as from January 1, 2016.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 1IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 1IN; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
	The above- referenced change has no
	material impact on the Company's consolidated financial statements.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 1IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.5IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	2.
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<U>
	Benefits under the Law for the Encouragement of Capital
	Investments - 1959
</U>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 1IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 1IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	An Israeli subsidiary of the Company
	was granted &ldquo;Approved Enterprise&rdquo; status in accordance with the Law for the Encouragement of Capital Investments &ndash;
	1959 (hereinafter &ndash; the Encouragement Law). The subsidiary received grants and was entitled to tax benefits relating to investment
	programs that were subject to Approved Enterprise certificates under the Encouragement Law prior to its 2011 amendment.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 1IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 1IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	On December 29, 2010 the Knesset approved
	the Economic Policy Law for 2011-2012, which includes an amendment to the Law for the Encouragement of Capital Investments &ndash;
	1959 (hereinafter &ndash; &ldquo;the Amendment&rdquo;). The Amendment is effective from January 1, 2011 and its provisions apply
	to preferred income derived or accrued in 2011 and thereafter by a preferred company, per the definition of these terms in the
	Amendment.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 1IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 1IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
</P>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 128; VALUE: 2 -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID">
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 33%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 34%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	F-
<!-- FIELD: SEQUENCE; TYPE: ARABIC; NAME: PAGENO -->
	51
<!-- FIELD: /SEQUENCE -->
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 33%; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage129"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<!-- FIELD: /PAGE -->
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
	SodaStream International Ltd.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 0.5PT SOLID">
<B>
	Notes to the Consolidated Financial
	Statements
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Note 22 - Income tax&ndash; (continued)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 1IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 1IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Amendment provides that only companies
	in Development Area A will be entitled to the grants track and that they will be entitled to receive benefits under this track
	and under the tax benefits track at the same time. In addition, the existing tax benefit tracks were eliminated (the tax exempt
	track, the &ldquo;Ireland&rdquo; track and the &ldquo;Strategic&rdquo; track) and two new tax tracks were introduced in their place,
	a preferred enterprise and a special preferred enterprise, which mainly provide a uniform and reduced tax rate for all the company&rsquo;s
	income entitled to benefits. On August 5, 2013 the Knesset passed the Law for Changes in National Priorities
<FONT STYLE="BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
	(Legislative
	Amendments for Achieving Budget Objectives in the Years 2013 and 2014) &ndash; 2013, which raised the tax rates on preferred income
	as from the 2014 tax year as follows: 9% for Development Area A and 16% for the rest of the country (compared with 7% for Development
	Area A and 12.5% for the rest of the country in 2013).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 1IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 1IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Amendment also provides that no
	tax will apply to a dividend distributed out of preferred income to a shareholder that is an Israeli resident company. A tax rate
	of 20% shall apply to a dividend distributed out of preferred income to an individual shareholder or foreign resident, subject
	to double taxation prevention treaties.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 56.7PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 1IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Furthermore, the Amendment provides
	relief with respect to the non-payment of tax on a dividend received by an Israeli resident company from profits of an approved/alternative/beneficiary
	enterprise that accrued in the benefits period according to the version of the law before its amendment, if the company distributing
	the dividend notifies the tax authorities by June 30, 2015 that it is applying the provisions of the Amendment and the dividend
	is distributed after the date of the notice (hereinafter &ndash; &ldquo;the relief&rdquo;). Furthermore, a distribution from profits
	of the exempt enterprise will be subject to tax by the distributing company.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 1IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 1IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The abovementioned
	Israeli subsidiary of the Company, whose enterprise is located in Development Area A, elected to be included in the scope of the
	amendment of the law as a preferred company as of the 2011 tax year. The subsidiary's entitlement to be included in the scope of
	the amendment is subject to fulfillment of certain conditions.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 1IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 12PT">
<B>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 1IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.05PT">
	The subsidiary
	is also qualified as &ldquo;Industrial Companies&rdquo; as defined in the Law for the Encouragement of Industry (Taxes) &ndash;
	1969 and accordingly, among other benefits, is entitled to higher rates of depreciation.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 36.05PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 129; VALUE: 2 -->

<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">

<!-- FIELD: /SEQUENCE -->

	(1) Including benefits arising from previously &nbsp;unrecognized tax loss, tax credit or temporary &nbsp;difference of a prior period (for which no deferred&nbsp;&nbsp;taxes were not recognized) that was used&nbsp;&nbsp;to reduce current tax expense

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
	SodaStream International Ltd.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 0.5PT SOLID">
<B>
	Notes to the Consolidated Financial
	Statements
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Note 22 - Income tax &ndash; (continued)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.5IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	2.
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<U>
	Unrecognized deferred tax assets
</U>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Total accumulated tax losses available
	for carry forward as of December 31, 2015 amounted to $82.0 million. The Group has not recognized $10.0 million of the potential
	future tax benefits since it is not probable that future taxable profit will be available against which the Group can utilize the
	benefits therefrom.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.5IN">
<B>
	E.
</B>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Tax assessments
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: -0.5IN">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0">
	During 2015 the Company has reached an agreement with the Israeli
	tax authority for finalizing its tax assessments and one of its subsidiaries for the years 2010 until and including 2013, and 2011
	until and including 2013 respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-INDENT: 114.55PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Tax authorities may have different interpretations
	than the Group&rsquo;s interpretations with regard to various tax issues. In the opinion of the Group&rsquo;s management, appropriate
	provisions have been included in the financial statements to cover estimated tax obligations.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Note 23 - Operational leases
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Group leases its headquarters facility,
	manufacturing and distribution facilities, sales offices and vehicles under long-term non-cancelable operating leases, certain
	of which provide for renewal options.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Leasing expenses for the year 2015 were $5.0
	million (2014: $9.3 million; 2013: $6.5 million).
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Future minimum lease payments for all existing
	long-term, non-cancelable operating leases as of December 31, 2015 are as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN">

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>

	the maximum credit exposure. The Group&rsquo;s maximum credit risk exposure, as of the reporting date, was as follows:

	The Group's trade receivables are
	composed mainly of different retailers or retailer groups in various countries. The Group&rsquo;s management considers that there
	is no significant concentration of credit risk.

	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 1IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: -0.5IN">
	(1) Includes Euro-zone
	countries and other countries that have sales denominated in Euros.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 91.5PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Group&rsquo;s most significant
	customer, a distributor located in Western Europe, accounts for $4.5 million of the trade and other receivables carrying amount
	at December 31, 2015 (December 31, 2014: $8.5 million).
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.5IN">
<B>
	Credit enhancements
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Most of the Group's trade receivables are insured
	by credit insurance policy provided by an international insurer. The insurance coverage is up to a cumulative credit limit of
	$252 million, providing an indemnification up to a cumulative $17 million per annum.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.5IN">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.5IN">
<B>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.5IN">
<B>
	B.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Liquidity
	risk
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.5IN">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Liquidity risk is the risk that
	the Group will encounter difficulty in meeting the obligations associated with its finance liabilities that are settled by delivering
	cash or another financial asset.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Group maintains credit facilities
	in order to meeting its obligation. The group intends to finance its long term investments by long term loans.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	As of December 31, 2015,
	the Group had outstanding debt in the amount of $33.9 million under secured long-term loan agreements. As of December 31,
	2015, the
	Group had short-term credit facilities with a total borrowing capacity of $10.7 million, of which none was outstanding as
	of such date. In addition, as at December 31, 2015, the Group entered into agreements in principle with financial
	institutions to receive additional credit in the total amount of up to $50.5 million. In connection with such agreements in
	principle, as at December 31, 2015, the Group borrowed $2.8 million as short-term debt.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>

	i.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Exposure

	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	The Group's exposure to foreign currency
	risk as of the reporting date was as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;

<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_63"></A>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 7PT">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>

	&nbsp;

<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 7PT">

	31, 2015
</FONT>

<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 7PT">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; PADDING-BOTTOM: 1PT; FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 7PT">
	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
	SodaStream International Ltd.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 0.5PT SOLID">
<B>
	Notes to the Consolidated
	Financial Statements
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Note 24 - Financial instruments &ndash;
	(continued)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	During 2015 and 2014, the Group held a
	number of derivative contracts to offset specific risks resulting from a difference in the currency in which Group entities generate
	their revenues and the currency in which part of the raw-material purchases are made.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	As of December 31, 2015, the Group&rsquo;s
	notional investment in currency options is $99 million
<BR>
	(2014: $78 million) with fair value of $631,000 (2014: $544,000).
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Information regarding significant exchange
	and spot rates applied during the year:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
