<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
	SodaStream International Ltd.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 0.5PT SOLID">
<B>
	Notes to the Consolidated
	Financial Statements
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Note 24 - Financial instruments &ndash;
	(continued)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	ii.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Sensitivity
	analysis
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	A strengthening or weakening
	of the U.S. Dollar, as indicated below, against the following currencies as of December 31, 2015 would have increased (decreased)
	equity and net income by the amounts shown below. This analysis is based on foreign currency exchange rate variances that the
	Group considered to be reasonably possible at the end of the reporting period. This analysis assumes that all other variables,
	in particular interest rates, remain constant.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<B>
	Notes to the Consolidated
	Financial Statements
</B>

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">

	&nbsp;
</B>

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Note 24 - Financial instruments &ndash;
	(continued)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	3.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<U>
	Fair
	value versus carrying amounts
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The carrying amounts of certain
	financial assets and liabilities, including cash and cash equivalents, bank deposits, trade receivables, derivative financial
	instruments, loans and borrowings, trade payables and other current liabilities are the same or proximate to their fair value.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	For further information regarding
	determination of fair values see note 4.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Fair value hierarchy
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The table below analyzes financial
	instruments carried at fair value by the valuation method.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The different hierarchy levels
	have been defined in note 4:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
	SodaStream International Ltd.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 0.5PT SOLID">
<B>
	Notes to the Consolidated
	Financial Statements
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
	Note 25 &ndash; Contingencies
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Legal proceedings
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	From time to time, the Group
	is a party to various legal proceedings (both as claimant and defendant) in the ordinary course of its business. In the opinion
	of the management of the Company, which is based on, among other things, the opinion of its legal counsels, appropriate provisions
	have been included in the financial statements (see Note 16), where warranted, to cover the exposure resulting from such claims.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 1IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Legal claims and proceedings
	(excluding claims with no specified amount, claims fully covered by the Group's insurance policy and claims where the likelihood
	of an outflow of resources is considered to be remote) amounted to $3.9 million as of December 31, 2015. The provision included
	in the financial statements for such legal claims and proceedings totaled $0.4 million as of December 31, 2015. Subsequent to
	the balance sheet date the Group agreed to settle a claim of $1.8 million resulting in compensation to the plaintiff of $0.2 million.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Group is also a party to
	various personal injury claims (of employees and consumers), as a direct party or a third party , in which the amounts of the
	claims are not specified. These claims are handled by the Group&rsquo;s insurers.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>

	for purposes of calculating the dilutive effect of share options was based on quoted market prices for the period that the options
	were outstanding.

	&nbsp;

	At December 31, 2015, 1,765 thousand options (in
	2014 and 2013: 609 thousand and 207 thousand, respectively) were excluded from the diluted weighted average number of ordinary
	shares calculation as their effect would have been anti-dilutive.

<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID">
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">

<A NAME="eolPage145"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<!-- FIELD: /PAGE -->
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
	SodaStream International Ltd.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 0.5PT SOLID">
<B>
	Notes to the Consolidated
	Financial Statements
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Note 27 - Share-based payments
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	In December 2007 and in October
	2010, the Group established two employee share option plans (hereinafter &ndash; the 2007 Option Plan and the 2010 Option Plan,
	respectively). The 2007 Option Plan and the 2010 Option Plan entitle key management personnel and senior employees to purchase
	the Company's shares. Each option entitles the option holder to purchase one ordinary share of the company at the exercise price.
	The 2007 Option Plan and the 2010 Option Plan are intended to provide an incentive to retain employees and to attract new employees
	that the Board of Directors determines provide services that are valuable to the Group. The administration of the 2007 Option
	Plan and the 2010 Option Plan is under the responsibility of a committee appointed by the Board of Directors.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The use of the term options
	in this note includes both share options and RSU unless stated otherwise.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	As of December 31, 2015, 2,342,296 ordinary shares
	were available for issuance under our option plans of which options to purchase 2,273,499 ordinary shares have been granted and
	are outstanding.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The options granted as of
	February 23, 2012, will expire ten years after the grant date. Options granted on or after February 23, 2012 but prior to
	February 26, 2013 will expire six years after the grant date. Options granted on or after February 26, 2013 will expire five
	years after the grant date.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The basic terms of the 2007
	and the 2010 Option Plans: 25% or 33.3% of the equity awards will vest one year after the date of grant and the remainder will
	vest in equal portions at the end of each three-month period thereafter over four or three years, respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	On December 20, 2012 the annual general meeting approved
	a grant of options to the CEO, according to which 135,000 options vest in January 2014, and 315,000 options vest in December 2015.
	The vesting on December 31, 2015 was subject to achieving a performance condition of Weighted Revenue EBITDA Measurement (as may
	be discounted) of at least 100%. In calculating the Weighted Revenue-EBITDA Measurement: &ldquo;Actual Cumulative Revenue&rdquo;
	equals the aggregate annual revenue as reported in the Company&rsquo;s annual audited financial statements at the end of each
	of the years of 2012 through 2015 (inclusive), and includes all or part of 2016 if the LTIP&rsquo;s term is extended; &ldquo;Actual
	Cumulative EBITDA&rdquo; equals the aggregate annual EBITDA as reported in the Company&rsquo;s disclosures at the end of each
	of the years 2012 through 2015 (inclusive), and includes all or part of 2016 if the LTIP&rsquo;s term is extended; &ldquo;Cumulative
	Revenue Target&rdquo; equals the aggregate revenue included in the annual budget as approved by the Company&rsquo;s board of directors
	for the four years of 2012 through 2015 (inclusive); and &ldquo;Cumulative EBITDA Target&rdquo; equals the aggregate EBITDA included
	in the annual budget as approved by the Company&rsquo;s board of directors for the four years of 2012 through 2015 (inclusive).
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	As of December 31, 2014, the estimate for achieving
	the abovementioned performance condition of Weighted Revenue EBITDA Measurement was less than 100% and was considered remote.
	Therefore, an expense of $4.8 million ($2.6 million with respect to prior years and $2.2 million with respect to 2014) related
	to the CEO grant of options was reversed. As of December 31, 2015 the above referenced performance conditions were not met.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	In December 2015 the annual
	general meeting approved a grant of 600,000 options to the CEO out of which 300,000 options vest at grant date and 300,000 options
	are subject to market condition of which 150,000 options shall become exercisable if at any time following the first anniversary
	of date of grant the Company's price per share exceeds $22. The remaining 150,000 options shall become exercisable if at any time
	following the second anniversary of date of grant the Company's price per share exceeds $27.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	In December 2015 the annual
	general meeting approved to grant to the CEO 100,000 options under the 2010 option plan and a cash bonus in the event of a strategic
	investment in the Company. The cash bonus shall be equal to 1% of the cash amount invested in the Company at the closing of the
	strategic investment up to a maximum bonus amount of $500,000. The strategic investment shall be in the aggregate amount of not
	less than $25 million and the identity of the investor would make a contribution to the Company beyond the actual sum of the purchase
	of share of the Company.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>

	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
	SodaStream International Ltd.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 0.5PT SOLID">
<B>
	Notes to the Consolidated
	Financial Statements
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Note 27 - Share-based payments &ndash;
	(continued)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Regarding the 2010 Option Plan
	with respect to non-employees directors, based on service providing periods, one third of the options included in each grant vest
	one year after the grant date, and the rest vest over the sequential two years, annually, in two equal portions.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The grants to employees and
	to some non-employees are pursuant to section 102(b) of the Israeli Income Tax Ordinance (capital gain option). The grants to
	certain non-employees are pursuant to section 3(i) of the Israeli Income Tax Ordinance (taxed as ordinary income).
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The option holder&rsquo;s rights
	to purchase shares will be adjusted upon certain events described in the 2007 Option Plan or in the 2010 Option Plan, subject
	to the approval of the applicable tax authority.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The terms and conditions of
	the grants are as follows; all options are to be settled by physical delivery of shares:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>

	Note 27 - Share-based payments
	&ndash; (continued)
</B>

	&nbsp;
</B>

<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.5IN">
	(1)
</TD>
<TD>
	25% - vests one year after grant date and an additional 6.25% vests
	at the end of each quarter beginning one year after the grant date
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>

	vests at the end of each year beginning one year after the grant date.
</TD>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	(9)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	300,000
	options fully vested at grant date out of which 190,000
</FONT>
	were granted in lieu of
	190,000 options which were cancelled. See sub note 9(ii) below
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	.
	The remaining 300,000 options are subject to market condition with a service period of
	one year from grant date for 50% of the options, and a service period of two years from
	grant date for the remaining 50% of the options.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.5IN; TEXT-INDENT: -0.5IN">
	&nbsp;

<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.5IN">
	(i)
</TD>
<TD>
	In November 2014, the Company modified the terms of part of the
	above grants by cancelling 494,496 outstanding options and granting in return 361,357
	new options with a lower exercise price. The new options include new vesting conditions
	as described in sub note 7 above.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.5IN; TEXT-INDENT: -0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.5IN">
	(ii)
</TD>
<TD>
	In December 2015, the Company modified the terms of part of the
	above grants by cancelling 190,000 outstanding options and granting in return 190,000
	options, fully vested, with lower exercise price. See sub note 9 above.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
	SodaStream International Ltd.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 0.5PT SOLID">
<B>
	Notes to the Consolidated
	Financial Statements
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 1IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: -0.5IN">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Note 27 - Share-based payments &ndash;
	(continued)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The options outstanding as at December
	31, 2015 have an exercise price of NIS 0.645, &euro;1.61, &euro;4.84, &euro;10.32, and $15 - $52 (2014: NIS 0.645, &euro;1.61,
	&euro;4.84, &euro;10.32, $20.00 and $22 - $52; 2013: NIS 0.645, &euro;1.61, &euro;4.84, &euro;10.32, $20.00 and $31 - $69). The
	weighted average share price at the date of exercise for options exercised in 2015 was $16.75 (2014: $36.9; 2013: $58.00).
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	B.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Information
	on measurement of fair value of share-based payment plans
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The grant date fair value of the options
	granted through the employee share option plans was measured based on the Black-Scholes formula for options with non-market conditions
	and based on Monte Carlo model for options with market conditions. See note 4D.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Expected volatility is estimated based
	on the weighted average historic volatility of the company's stocks and of comparable companies over the expected term of the
	options. The expected life until exercise date of the option is determined based on averaging the vesting schedule of the options
	and the contractual term, since the Company's ordinary shares commenced trading in November 2010 and therefore there is insufficient
	history of option exercises. The risk-free interest was determined on the basis of AAA-rated Euro area central government bonds
	for grants prior to December 31, 2011, and for grant from January 1, 2012 onwards on the basis of the appropriate yield rates
	of non-indexed linked U.S. Federal Reserve treasury bonds for the expected term.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The inputs used in the measurement of
	the fair values at grant date of the share-based payment plans were as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>

	is 2.6% for management (including non-employees) and 3.5% for other employees based on the Company's assessment.

<B>
	Notes to the Consolidated
	Financial Statements
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
	Note 28 - Related parties
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	A.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Key
	management personnel compensation
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	In addition to their remuneration,
	the Group also provides non-cash benefits (such as vehicles) to key management personnel. Key management personnel are also entitled
	to post-employment benefits (for which the Group contributes to a defined benefit plan on their behalf) and participate in the
	Company&rsquo;s share option plan (see Note 15 and Note 27, respectively).
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Compensation to key management
	personnel:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.5IN">

	&nbsp;

	(*) The share-based payment
	presented in this table does not include $4.8 million related to the reversed CEO grant of options. See note 27 above.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	(**) The long-term employee benefits include a cash bonus of
	$1.2 million in connection with the long-term incentive plan for the Company&rsquo;s Chief Executive Officer which was approved
	by our shareholders on December 20, 2012 (&ldquo;the Bonus&rdquo;). Subsequent to the balance sheet date, the Company&rsquo;s Chief
	Executive Officer notified the Company unilaterally to defer and condition the payment of 50% of the Bonus with the achievement
	or overachievement of the Company&rsquo;s operating income target for the year ended December 31, 2016 as per its 2016 budget.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	B.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Exculpation,
	insurance and indemnification of key management personnel
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Group&rsquo;s key management
	personnel and directors are covered by a directors&rsquo; and officers&rsquo; liability insurance policy. In addition, the Company
	has entered into agreements with each of its key management personnel and directors exculpating them, to the fullest extent permitted
	by law, from liability to the Company for damages caused to the Company as a result of a breach of duty of care, and undertaking
	to indemnify them to the fullest extent permitted by law. The maximum amount set forth in such agreement is (1) with respect to
	indemnification in connection with a public offering of the Company&rsquo;s securities, the gross proceeds raised by the Company
	and/or any selling shareholder in such public offering, and (2) with respect to all permitted indemnification, including a public
	offering of the Company&rsquo;s securities, the greater of (a) an amount equal to 50% of the shareholders&rsquo; equity on a consolidated
	basis, based on the Company's recent financial statements made publicly available before the date on which the indemnity payment
	is made and (b) $50 million.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<A NAME="V436888_EX4-3_HTM"></A>
<EFX_EXHIBIT_4>
<A NAME="FIS_EXHIBIT_4"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0">
	&nbsp;
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
<B>
	EXHIBIT 4.3
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
<B>
	SODASTREAM INTERNATIONAL
	LTD.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
<B>
	COMPENSATION POLICY
	FOR OFFICE HOLDERS
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
	(Originally adopted
	on December 23, 2013; Last Amended December 22, 2015)
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
<B>
	I. Preamble
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
	In
	accordance with the Israeli Companies Law, 5759-1999 (as amended from time to time, the &ldquo;
<B>
	Companies Law
</B>
	&rdquo;), this
	document states the terms of SodaStream International Ltd.&rsquo;s Compensation Policy for its &ldquo;
<B>
	Office Holders
</B>
	&rdquo;
	(as such term is defined in the Companies Law) (the&nbsp;&ldquo;
<B>
	Compensation Policy
</B>
	&rdquo;).
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
	The
	effective date of this Compensation Policy is the date of its approval by SodaStream&rsquo;s shareholders and it shall serve as
	the Compensation Policy of SodaStream International Ltd. (&ldquo;
<B>
	SodaStream
</B>
	&rdquo; or the &ldquo;
<B>
	Company
</B>
	&rdquo;),
	as required by the Companies Law.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
	The
	adoption of this Compensation Policy will not grant any of SodaStream&rsquo;s current or future Office Holders a right to receive
	any components of compensation set forth in this Compensation Policy or otherwise. The components of compensation to which an Office
	Holder will be entitled will be exclusively those that are determined specifically in relation to him or her and in accordance
	with the requirements of the Companies Law and the regulations promulgated thereunder. Nothing in this Compensation Policy shall
	be deemed to provide any rights or remedies to any person.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
	This
	Compensation Policy will apply to compensation of Office Holders determined after its effective date and will not, and is not intended
	to, apply to or be deemed to amend employment and/or compensation terms of Office Holders existing prior to such date. The terms
	of employment and compensation of Mr. Daniel Birnbaum, the Company&rsquo;s current Chief Executive Officer, including the terms
	approved at the meeting of the Company&rsquo;s shareholders held on December 20, 2012 and as described in the Company&rsquo;s proxy
	statement, as amended, filed with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission on November 23, 2012 and the terms approved at the
	meeting of the Company&rsquo;s shareholders held on December 22, 2015 and as described in the Company&rsquo;s amended proxy statement,
	filed with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission on November 30, 2015, shall be deemed incorporated by reference in this
	Compensation Policy, and this Compensation Policy shall not otherwise relate to the terms of employment and compensation of Mr.
	Birnbaum.
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<SUP>
	1
</SUP>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
	In
	this Compensation Policy, the term &ldquo;
<B>
	Non
</B>
	-
<B>
	Executive
</B>
<B>
	Director
</B>
	&rdquo; is defined as a member of the Company&rsquo;s
	board of directors (the &ldquo;
<B>
	Board of Directors
</B>
	&rdquo;) who is not employed by the Company or one of its subsidiaries
	in any other position.
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<SUP>
	2
</SUP>
</FONT>
	Unless expressly
	stated otherwise, this Compensation Policy relates to all Office Holders other than Non-Executive Directors and the Company&rsquo;s
	Chief Executive Officer.
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<SUP>
	3
</SUP>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
</P>
<!-- FIELD: RULE-PAGE -->
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 1PT; BORDER-TOP: BLACK 1PT SOLID; WIDTH: 25%">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
</DIV>
<!-- FIELD: /RULE-PAGE -->
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<SUP>
	1
</SUP>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
</FONT>
	Since the terms of employment and compensation of Mr. Birnbaum, the Company&rsquo;s current Chief Executive Officer, were
	duly approved by the Company&rsquo;s shareholders, Mr. Birnbaum&rsquo;s terms of employment are excluded for the purposes of the
	limitations in this Compensation Policy, including the Fixed-Variable Ratio, and were disregarded in determining them.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<SUP>
	2
</SUP>
	To the extent the Company shall
	have an active chairman or active vice-chairman of the board, such person would not be considered as a Non-Executive Director.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<SUP>
	3
</SUP>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
</FONT>
	References in this Compensation Policy to the employment or terms of employment of Office Holders shall also apply to the
	provision of services by Office Holders under a service contract (whether with such Office Holder or an entity controlled by him
	or her),
<I>
	mutatis mutandis
</I>
	. References to base salaries with respect to Office Holders with a service contract would mean
	the base fees payable under such contract. Value Added Tax payable by the Company under such service contract, if any, will not
	be considered or deemed to be part of an Office Holder&rsquo;s compensation.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 1; OPTIONS: NEWSECTION; VALUE: 1 -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID">
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<!-- FIELD: SEQUENCE; TYPE: ARABIC; NAME: PAGENO -->
	1
<!-- FIELD: /SEQUENCE -->
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage151"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<!-- FIELD: /PAGE -->
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
<B>
	II. Company Philosophy
	and Compensation Policy Objectives
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
	SodaStream
	believes that an effective executive compensation program is one that is designed to reward achievements and performance of its
	Office Holders and which aligns their interests with those of the Company and its shareholders. To achieve this, the fixed components
	(i.e., base salary, benefits and perquisites) of an Office Holder&rsquo;s total compensation package will generally not be higher
	compared with the market, and a significant portion of an Office Holder&rsquo;s total compensation package will generally be comprised
	of variable compensation components. SodaStream also seeks to ensure that its ability to attract and retain superior employees
	in key positions is maintained and that the compensation provided to key employees remains competitive relative to the total compensation
	of similarly situated executives in peer companies and the broader marketplace from which it recruits and competes for talent.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 35.45PT; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
	In
	formulating this Compensation Policy, SodaStream has considered, among other things, the following considerations:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 35.45PT; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 35.45PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	advancing the objectives of the Company, its work plan and long-term strategy;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 56.7PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: -21.25PT; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 35.45PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	creating appropriate incentives to Office Holders of the Company, taking into account, among other
	things, the risk management policies of the Company;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 56.7PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: -21.25PT; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 35.45PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	the Company&rsquo;s size, complexity and the nature and landscape of its operations, including
	that the Company is a global company headquartered in Israel operating throughout the value chain;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 56.7PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: -21.25PT; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 35.45PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	regarding those sections of the Compensation Policy that provide for variable compensation components
	&ndash; the Office Holder&rsquo;s contribution to achieving corporate objectives and profit maximization, with a long-term perspective
	and in accordance with the role and position of the Office Holder with the Company.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 56.7PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: -21.25PT; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
	In
	determining the compensation for each Office Holder, among other relevant factors, the following considerations shall be taken
	into account:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 35.45PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	the education, professional experience and achievements of the Office Holder;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 56.7PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: -21.25PT; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 35.45PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	the Office Holder&rsquo;s position in the Company (including geographical considerations), scope
	of responsibilities and contribution to the Company;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 56.7PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: -21.25PT; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 35.45PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	the circumstances of the Office Holder&rsquo;s recruitment (which may include compensation arrangements
	with his or her previous employer) and the terms of prior employment or service agreements with the Company (if any);
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 56.7PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: -21.25PT; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 35.45PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	a comparison of the terms of compensation of the Office Holder to the terms of compensation of
	other Office Holders in the Company, and to the extent such information is timely available, to terms of compensation of executives
	in similar positions in peer-group companies; and
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 56.7PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: -21.25PT; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 2; VALUE: 1 -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID">
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">

	2
<!-- FIELD: /SEQUENCE -->

<A NAME="eolPage152"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<!-- FIELD: /PAGE -->
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 35.45PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	a comparison of the total cost of compensation of the Office Holder and the Cost of Salary (as
	such term is defined in Part A of the First Addendum to the Companies Law) of all Israeli employees of the Company (including,
	to the extent applicable, Manpower Contractors Engaged by the Company (as such term is defined in Part A of the First Addendum
	to the Companies Law)), other than the Office Holder, if applicable, and most notably the ratio between the compensation of Office
	Holders and the median and average salary of all such Company employees, and the ramifications of such ratio on the labor relations
	of the Company. For the year ended December 31, 2012, the ratio between the highest total compensation package of an Office Holder
	(excluding Non-Executive Directors and the current Chief Executive Officer) and the median and average salary of all such Company
	employees was 1:22 and 1:18, respectively. The Compensation Committee and the Board of Directors determined that said ratios are
	reasonable taking into account the size, complexity and the nature of the Company and its operations and are not expected to have
	an adverse effect on the labor relations of the Company.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 56.7PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: -21.25PT; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 35.45PT; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
	To
	the extent relevant, necessary and available, peer-group companies will be selected to provide an appropriate comparative model.
	Peer-group companies will be selected based on appropriate similarities taking into account a number of factors, which may include:
	market capitalization, type of industry, location of listing of the Company&rsquo;s securities, level of revenues, number of employees,
	geographical considerations, factors of relevance to the particular Office Holder&rsquo;s role and other factors that will be considered
	relevant to the comparison.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 35.45PT; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
<B>
	III. Compensation
	Components
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
	&nbsp;The
	compensation package of Office Holders may consist of one or more of the following components:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 20.7PT">
	(i)
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	base cash compensation;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 56.7PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: -20.7PT; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 20.7PT">
	(ii)
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	benefits and perquisites;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 56.7PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: -20.7PT; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 20.7PT">
	(iii)
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	annual performance-based cash incentives and other discretionary cash compensation;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 56.7PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: -20.7PT; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 20.7PT">
	(iv)
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	long-term equity-based compensation (such as options to purchase the Company&rsquo;s ordinary shares
	or other equity-based instruments, including restricted stock units, restricted stock and stock appreciation rights, (collectively,
	&ldquo;
<B>
	Equity Awards
</B>
	&rdquo;)); and
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 56.7PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: -20.7PT; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 20.7PT">
	(v)
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	retirement and termination of service arrangements.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 56.7PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: -20.7PT; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
	The
	total compensation package and components thereof may vary between Office Holders, taking into account the factors described above.
	To reflect the Company&rsquo;s philosophy and Compensation Policy objectives, with respect to any Office Holder, the ratio between
	the fixed compensation components and the variable compensation components in any given year on an annual basis shall not be more
	than 1:8 (the &ldquo;
<B>
	Fixed-Variable Ratio
</B>
	&rdquo;). Discretionary bonuses, including one-time cash payment upon recruitment
	or promotion, and retirement and termination benefits, as described below, shall be disregarded and not taken into account for
	the purposes of calculating the Fixed-Variable Ratio.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 3; VALUE: 1 -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID">
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<!-- FIELD: SEQUENCE; TYPE: ARABIC; NAME: PAGENO -->
	3
<!-- FIELD: /SEQUENCE -->
	&nbsp;

	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<!-- FIELD: /PAGE -->
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
<B>
	A.
</B>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
<I>
	Base Cash Compensation (Base Salary)
</I>
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 21.25PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: -21.25PT; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 21.25PT; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
	The
	monthly gross base salary of any one of our Office Holders shall not exceed NIS 100,000
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<SUP>
	4
</SUP>
</FONT>
	.
	The monthly gross base salary may be increased from time to time, subject to the aforesaid limit.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 21.25PT; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
<B>
	B.
</B>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
<I>
	Benefits
</I>
<I>
	and Perquisites
</I>
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 21.25PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: -21.25PT; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
	&nbsp;Certain
	benefits and perquisites for our Office Holders are provided in order to comply with legal requirements, while others serve as
	an additional component of the compensation packages offered to Office Holders.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
	Benefits
	and perquisites, including those which are required or facilitated under local laws or are customary in the relevant jurisdiction
	may include, among others, the following:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 35.45PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	contributions to pension funds and/or similar schemes such as manager&rsquo;s insurance programs;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 56.7PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: -21.25PT; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 35.45PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	contributions to education funds;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 56.7PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: -21.25PT; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 35.45PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	car allowance or company car and related benefits, including tolls;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 56.7PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: -21.25PT; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 35.45PT">
</TD>

</TD>
